summary: Constance C. Smith was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCA). The documents available are payroll and certification reports indicating her employment with the committee. These documents list her name, and in some cases, her salary and social security number, during different periods in 1978. The reports cover the months of April, August, and December of 1978, providing a timeline of her employment within that year.
significance: Constance C. Smith's significance lies in her employment with the Select Committee on Assassinations. While the specific role she played is not detailed in these documents, her presence on the payroll indicates she was part of the team investigating the JFK assassination.
